info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 3:29PM MDT until August 04 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE SPRING BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN COSTILLA AND WEST CENTRAL HUERFANO COUNTIES... At 329 PM MDT, Heavy rain has ended across the Spring Burn Scar, with doppler radar estimates of between 0.8 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen, with the greatest amounts in the Middle Creek drainage northward into Paradise Acres. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the warning area will cause mud slides near steep terrain. The mud slide can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Spring Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Spring Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160, northeastern Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county, Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Huerfano county, Indian Creek on the southeastern Spring Burn Scar and La Veta Pass. This includes the following high risk locations... South Abeyta Creek near County Road 443, South Abeyta Creek near County Road 442, South Abeyta Creek near County Road 441 and Pass Creek Road. This includes the following streams and drainages... Wagon Creek, Yellowstone Creek, Middle Creek, North abeyta Creek, South Abeyta Creek, Spring Branch, South Oak Creek, Sangre de Cristo Creek, Pass Creek, Palo Duro Creek, Oak Creek, North Middle Creek, South Middle Creek, Martin Creek and Missouri Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Spring Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
